```ENV["JULIA_PKG_SERVER"] = ""```
, that will make Julia fetch servers from GitHub instead of its own servers.

attachments.title: Very slow "Updating registry at 'C:\Users\me\.julia\registries\General'"
attachments.text: You can do the following: pkg> registry rm General julia> ENV["JULIA_PKG_SERVER"] = "" pkg> registry add General Now it will update using Git which should be faster on windows. Only need to do this once.

elements.text: Try
https://discourse.julialang.org/t/very-slow-updating-registry-at-c-users-me-julia-registries-general/51614/2?u=kristoffer.carlsson

text:
You can also try adding to `.julia/config/startup.jl` this:
```using Pkg: Pkg
Pkg.UPDATED_REGISTRY_THIS_SESSION[] = true```
This means `] add SomeThing` will skip the registry update, and just add the highest version when last you updated. `] up` will still trigger an update.
